section.section: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Agent" means a person that acts or is authorized to act as the representative of a bail bondsman.
"Bail bondsman" means a licensed limited surety agent or a licensed professional bail bondsman.
"Bail bondsman" does not include a person that contracts with a public agency to provide bail bonds to persons detained in a correctional facility.

text.section:
On the grounds of a courthouse or correctional facility, a bail bondsman, an agent of a bail bondsman, an employee of the courthouse, or an employee of a correctional facility may not:
approach, entice, or invite a person to use the services of a specific bail bondsman;
distribute, display, or wear an item that advertises the services of a bail bondsman; or
otherwise solicit business as a bail bondsman.

A person who violates subsection (b) of this section is guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction is subject to:
a fine not exceeding $2,500, and if licensed in accordance with the Insurance Article, a 30-day license suspension for a first offense; and
a fine not exceeding $5,000, and if licensed in accordance with the Insurance Article, a 90-day license suspension for a subsequent offense.
A person convicted of a violation of subsection (b) of this section shall be referred to the Insurance Commissioner for appropriate action.
